title: 3 bizarre (and delightful) ancient theories about bird migration - Lucy Cooke

multiple-choice.question: What was found impaled in the stork shot down by Count Christian Ludwig von Bothmer in 1822?
What was the significance of the wooden spear found in the stork?

options.label: A
options.text: It indicated the stork was from a local species.

options.label: B
options.text: It suggested the stork was speared in Africa and flew to Germany.

options.label: C
options.text: It showed the stork was a migratory bird.

options.label: D
options.text: It proved the stork was a rare species.

multiple-choice.question: What was one of Aristotle's theories to explain the seasonal disappearance of birds?

options.label: A
options.text: Birds transformed into different bodies that suited the season.

multiple-choice.question: Which bird species is known to truly hibernate during the winter?
What was the purpose of Johannes Thienemann's experiment with aluminum rings on storks?

options.label: A
options.text: To track the migration route of storks

options.label: B
options.text: To study the behavior of storks

options.label: C
options.text: To determine the population size of storks

options.label: D
options.text: To identify the different species of storks

multiple-choice.question: How many aluminum rings were returned to Johannes Thienemann from Africa?
What was the result of Johannes Thienemann's experiment?

options.label: A
options.text: The discovery of a new species of stork

options.label: B
options.text: The plotting of the first migration route ever discovered

options.label: C
options.text: The proof that storks hibernate during the winter

options.label: D
options.text: The evidence that storks migrate to the moon

multiple-choice.question: Approximately what percentage of bird species migrate each year?
How do birds navigate during their migration?
What can alter the migration paths of birds?
